Does the Gray Wolf share an ancestry with the domestic dog?	Yes
Does the Gray Wolf share an ancestry with the domestic dog?	Yes
Does the Gray Wolf share an ancestry with the domestic dog?	Yes.
Do wolf pups tend to have darker fur than adults?	Yes
Do wolf pups tend to have darker fur than adults?	Yes, They do tend to have darker furs
Do wolves leave their pack?	Yes
Do wolves leave their pack?	They leave their birth pack when they reach sexual maturity
What kinds of coats do wolves have?	bulky coats with two layers
What kinds of coats do wolves have?	Tough guard hairs that repel water and dirt, and a dense, water-resistant layer
Where do wolves have scent glands?	Helping the woldf to effectively navigate over large expanses while concurrently keeping others informed of its whereabouts.
Where do wolves have scent glands?	between a wolf's toes
How much do wolves weigh?	typically varies between 32 and 62 kilograms
How much do wolves weigh?	between 32 and 68 kilograms 
Why do wolves howl?	Howling helps pack members keep in touch, allowing them to communicate effectively in thickly forested areas or over great distances. Howling also helps to call pack members to a specific location. Howling can also serve as a declaration of territory, as shown in a dominant wolf&apos;s tendency to respond to a human imitation of a "rival" wolf in an area the wolf considers its own. 
Why do wolves howl?	To pack members keep in touch, allowing them to communicate effectively in thickly forested areas or over great distances
What is surplus killing?	Surplus killing is defined as the killing of several prey animals too numerous to eat at one sitting.
What is surplus killing?	the killing of several prey animals too numerous to eat at one sitting
Are Gray Wolves native to North America?	Yes
Are Gray Wolves native to North America?	No. Current theory suggests that it's from Eurasia
Is the Gray Wolf a mammal?	Yes
Is the Gray Wolf a mammal?	Yes
Are a wolf's teeth its main weapons?	Yes
Are a wolf's teeth its main weapons?	Yes
Are wolves built for stamina?	Yes
Are wolves built for stamina?	Yes
Where is the largest gray wolf population thought to be found?	Kazakhstan
Where is the largest gray wolf population thought to be found?	Kazakhstan
To what genus does the gray wolf belong?	Canis
To what genus does the gray wolf belong?	Canis
When do wolves molt?	Late Spring or Early Summer
When do wolves molt?	late spring or early summer
Why is it beneficial for alpha males and females to forcefully prevent other wolves from mating?	A pack can only suppport one littler per year
Why is it beneficial for alpha males and females to forcefully prevent other wolves from mating?	The pack tension rises as each mature wolf feels urged to mate
What type of tools do biologists use to capture wolves for tagging?	Darting and Foot hold traps.
What type of tools do biologists use to capture wolves for tagging?	Darting and foot hold traps
Forward, erect ears and slightly bristle hackles are a sign of what in wolves?	Dominance
Forward, erect ears and slightly bristle hackles are a sign of what in wolves?	Dominance
